snippet: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey waited until the last minute to make a decision on the bill, which would have become law automatically if he had not taken action by Monday.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie signs bill outlawing therapy that aims to convert gay children to heterosexuals, making New Jersey the second state to ban the controversial practice.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey waited until the last minute to make a decision on the bill, which would have become law automatically if he had not taken action by Monday.

headline.main: Christie Signs Bill Outlawing a Gay ‘Cure’
